content.detailedDescription:
At approximately 11:30pm; i felt a sudden and striking urge to go outside onto the side deck of hooligans pub and look up at the stars. this i frequently do to flex my minor in astro-physics. 

i sat on top of one of the wooden outdoor picnic tables and was instantly drawn to a vertically compressed and horizontally stretched smallish "u" letter shaped cloud. the sky was mostly clear; this was one of a handful of small visible clouds that particular night.

i stared at it for about 1-2 minutes. no more than 120 seconds. right around the 120 second mark, i was wondering why i was so deliberately staring at this smallish cloud. 

then suddenly two glowing light-blue; what i can only describe as blue-nozzles ignited and burned for about 10-20 seconds. then whatever it was jumped and was gone. as if it was building up some version of critical velocity. instantly it vanished through the small "u" shaped cloud.

i never saw the body of the object.

i used the hand-method to estimate that it was about 10 degrees in apparent aperture. (per nozzle i mean)

the object was sighted close to due east. call it about an 80 degree azimuth measured from the north. just short of 3'oclock; or just left and above one of the local radio booster beacons. 

it was on a declination of about 30 degrees or so, though a background hill obscured my true line of sight.

3. the description of "nozzle" that i am using is analogous to something of terrestrial origin. though even the hand method confirms that said nozzles (2) were much wider than the saturn rocket or any soviet or nasa heavy-lifting traditional chemical propulsion system. the possibility of an x (experimental) or skunkworks sighting has occurred to me as well. 

4. motion appeared to be perfectly linear or along a straight line out of my line of sight. 

5. i felt exhilarated. my third u.F.O. sighted. this one i was unable to debunk. (one of the other three was completely explained)

6. hmmmm, my best take is that whatever it was nearly instantly accelerated away so far that it was gone in a second or so.
content.summary: Twin nozzle looking u.F.O.

content.detailedDescription:
While watching the night sky with a group, i noticed 3 red lights in a broad "v" formation. they were noticed because there had been 2 or 3 known aircraft passing by just before the lights were seen, and some of the group thought this was another aircraft. no other lights on the object were seen, as in no strobe or navigation lights. the lights were passing from roughly east to west. they stayed the same position and distance relative to each other. there was no sound. i am unable to provide good estimates as to altitude, size, or distance to the object, due to a lack of reference points. the distance from the object was probably over 1 mile. the inclination was approximately 45 to 75 degrees. i will say, however, that if the object was at cruising altitude for a commercial aircraft, it would have been very large - much larger than any known aircraft - based on the distance between the two outer lights. the object was in view for approximately 2 minutes. there was no change in speed, altitude, or direction. the object stayed in constant sight until it was obscured by some trees.

the lights were steady (not blinking) with the center and forward-most light perhaps a little dimmer than the other 2.

the night was very clear, with minimal man-made light pollution. the area i was in was farmland, with some trees. there was about a 1/3 moon, with the moon behind me and hidden by trees. 

i had from the first thought it to be a ufo of some type. i grew up in the airline industry, and have lived near airports and air force bases for many years, plus have over 2o years military experience - 10 of which were in the air force. i have a good grasp of what aircraft should look like, and this did not fit anything i've seen before.
content.summary: Three red lights in v shape

content.detailedDescription: A cigar shaped ufo two goldish dim lights travling fast south over houses, about 600-800 feet est. pretty low did not see a outline of the object .The lights where moving like it was connected. it reached the end of the block in my neighborhood it dissapeared turned off its lights. the whole object was moving left to right . but going straight. no sound!
content.summary: Cigar shaped didnt see a 3rd light but the cigar shape was moving south.

content.detailedDescription:
Hey guy's. i will say, this is my first encounter. i was standing at my kitchen sink fixing mom's breakfast when i looked up and something in the sky caught my eye. i looked and said "what is that" and then said "no way" so i went out the back door to spot it to see if there was any sound...No sound, so i went back in, grabbed my binoculars, went back out and got a good look at my first ufo. isn't it funny how when something like this happens your camera isn't right beside you. i watched it for approximately 1 1/2 to 2 minutes, gliding saliently across the sky just below the clouds. it started getting behind my roof so i repositioned myself to watch it more. i was too shaky to see it so i repositioned myself again against my gas grill, but it disappeared. that's my story. would you please let me know if anyone else reports something near my location. thanks a bunch.  ( "an avid sky watcher")

it was approximately 2 inch's long in the binoculars (reference)
it was what i would call oblong oval shaped. almost cigar like.
it was very shiney and silver in color.
traveling south west.
content.summary: Thin oval, shiney, silvery, satin finish

content.detailedDescription:
one multi-color object stayed in the same place for approximately two hours. i was in a road (fern���o dias interstate) driving to north. this object was blinking and my first opinion i was watching a commercial plane, but the light was strong and blinking like a cell phone antenna (cell site).
but near pouso alegre, cambu���, varginha and all region, there is no airport with commercial flights. 

the half moon was on my left and the object was visible on my front. suddenly the object flashes and make an trajectory like a shooting star and disappeared.
content.summary: Multi-color blinking like one cell site.

content.detailedDescription:
Sept 19,2009
noticed bright object in western sky at daylight was still there when sun set and still bright.. didnt watch to see how long it stayed in one spot checked on it in an hr was still there..
content.summary: Noticed bright object in western sky at daylight about powerline level

content.detailedDescription:
4 people were sitting in a backyard talking and 3 of the people saw the flying v. i saw it for maybe 1.5 sec, after someone originally notice it 

it was traveling faster than any satellite, and extremely quiet. it was maybe flying at 20,000 ft. and covered the night sky in seconds
content.summary: Flying v aircraft passed over the sky quickly

content.detailedDescription:
I cannot remember the exact date of the event, but it was approximately 9:00 pm and the moon was at about the 10:00 position in the southeastern evening sky.

i was sitting on my back porch relaxing smoking a cigar.  no alcohol or drugs were being used whatsoever.  i was looking towards the moon and from directly above my head at a considerable altitude, i saw a bright white light that was moving from the northwest to the southeast which appeared to be going at a significant speed.  the object did not have any tail or stream.  it went from an extreme bright light to a dim light which i could barely see because of the light of the moon.  when it went dim, it took a sharp "right" turn towards the south.  i watched as long as i could until it disappeared.

at first i thought it may be a satellite, but i have never seen a satellite be extremely bright, turn dim, and change direction.

i am 44 years old and have never seen a ufo in my life.  i have always believed in the possibility of ufos.  i am retired air force and am very familiar with common aircraft movements and lighting in the night sky.  i have never seen such a thing before.
content.summary: Bright light high speed dimming and changing directions.

content.altitude: Over 500 Feet (under cloudcover), Over 500 Feet (no cloudcover)
content.detailedDescription:
My dad was on the computer and he saw a bright light in the sky. at first he thought it was a air balloon, but the object was too bright and hoovering quickly. the object was shaped like a diamond and changed shape. 
we was all just looking trying to make out what the object was. kirsty has taped the object on her mobile phone, for about 20 minutes. it was not a clear version on the phone but you can tell it's not a balloon, and it's not a aeroplane. we looked at the sky so much i eyes started to hurt with the sun so we walked away from window and have contacted you right away. we would love to know what the object was. is there anyway we can send you the recordings, so you can tell us what it is. thanks kirsty gunning.
content.summary: A very bright diamond shape in the sky

content.detailedDescription:
I have today been sitting in the garden at my girlfriends house as the weather is nice and had been looking at various planes circling for heathrow over past few hours with my 8 x 40 binoculars, while she was reading a book. no i am not a spotter but was just bored.
anyway, i went to put the garden chair away as the sun was sinkin lower in the sky and we were losing the sunlight and had a last look up to spot any planes but saw a stationary disc or sphere  in the blue sky that was reflecting the sun brightly,  so then looked with binoculars and could see a craft that looked first like a half see throgh (fluorecent) and half metal object but as it was so high i couldnt focus right in on it.Hard to explain but with naked eye it was definitely a ball or sphere. i  called my girlfriend to have a look and she saw it to. she thought there was a few balls spheres or discs close together. then while she was still lookin at it ,i could see with the naked eye that it had gone from stationary to the other side of the sky across the neighbours house in  5 0r 6 seconds. i know from watching aircraft occasionaly that it would take a cruising plane at 30, 000 feet + some 1 minute to cover, so that means it was awesome in speed and it was definitely 40,000 + feet up.
the poor girlfriend was sayin where has it gone while it was probably several miles away!Wish we had more time to view it.
a weird sighting it was. yes i am a believer but  i have never seen any object move like that or at such height!
content.summary: Silver sphere or ball, stationary and high, then shot off at  immense speed

content.detailedDescription: My wife, two daughters (madison and jade) and i were at a girl scout event saturday night just outside of columbia. the function was being held at the university of missroui's bradford farms. it is an annual event which includes roasting hot dogs and walking through a corn maze with flashlights. we walked to the corn maze and entered it as a family with a friend (noni) who has a child in the same scouting troop. as we were trying to find our way through the maze, my wife looked up and saw what at first we thought was a satelite. i am an amature astronomer so we have looked for and seen many iridium flares. at first we thought, "oh wow, we just caught one by accident". we watched it waiting for it to fade out as they do, but it never did. i also noticed how much brighter it was compared to other satelites i have seen. the light seemed to give off points as in the star on top of a christmas tree. the points at the top and sides of equal length and the points at the ene, ese, wnw and wsw point a little shorter. this may have been a trick of light, but it was something that i took note of. the friend that was with us said it must be an airplane and i stated that it had no flashing lights, red or white as seen on normal air craft. i was in the air force and have seen hundreds of different air craft, if not more. this did not look like any terrestrial air craft i have ever see. then she said i can here an air plane. we then noticed an air plane flying over us and yes we could hear it. it gave us a perfect contrast to what we were seeing. the plane had visible lights flashing and we could hear engine noise. the bright white light had no flashing light and made no audible noise. another characteristic was that it seemed to meander through the sky. not a straight line. like it was taking it's time. it was heading from the west north west to the east south east direction and flew directly over the top of us. i would estimate it's altitude at roughly 3,000 to 5,000 feet. maybe lower. the contrasting airplane we saw seemed to be higher than the object. after we watched it go out of sight we continued to walk through the maze and returned to where the others were. we could see jupiter in the night sky to the south and this object seemed to be a little brighter than that. about a half an hour later a helicopter flew by making noise and again show visible flashing lights giving us one more example of what it definately was not. this has been my third sighting in the last 2-3 years of something that i could not identify. two were lights at night and my first was a daytime sighting.
content.summary: Bright light moving quickly across the night sky

content.detailedDescription: A friend and myself were camping at a u.S. forest service campground along the middle fork of the boise river in idaho.  the campground was dubbed 'troutville' and is located approximately 1/3rd of the way to atlanta on middle fork road from arrowrock dam.  i'm a big star gazer and amateur astronomer and haven't been away from city lights for a number of years, so i was taking the opportunity to soak in as much as i could.  i had already witnessed about 10 satellites in orbit when, at approximately 11 pm (i forgot my watch and my friend forgot the car charger for her cellphone and her battery was kaput, so i had no means of checking the time exactly) while looking at an area of the sky to the northwest around the constellations of perseus, cassiopeia and andromeda, i saw what appeared to me as one of those 'aerial bombs' that go off at firework shows (the ones that are just a mere flash of white light but produce a huge concussion).  i focused on the spot that the flash happened at and began to wonder what would make such a bright flash.  i asked my friend if she saw it as well, and she had.  about 20 seconds later it happened again in what appeared to be the very same spot. my friend was no longer looking at that spot and i informed her that it had happened again and we began to discuss scenarios that might explain the phenomenon, from a new pulsar to a ground based defense laser firing at a target satellite to sunlight reflecting off of individual solar panels on the iss and countless other things that might explain it.  even though i witnessed a massive 'black boomerang' in 1994 that was undoubtedly an e.T., i'm not the type to assume that every anomaly in the sky is a visitor from another planet.  i decided that if i saw it any more times that i would time it to see whether it was reoccurring at precise intervals. when it happened the third time i started counting out loud "one thousand one.  one thousand two, etc", and i also moved so that the top of a pine tree was horizontal to where it happened at, this way i could tell if it was moving, if at all.  when i counted out to 20 it happened again but i couldn't be sure if it had moved any.  when the next flash occurred it was at the 18 count, and i could tell that it was indeed moving, albeit very slowly, from the region of the constellation of andromeda towards perseus.  the next time it happened i had counted all the way to 22 and it had become noticeably dim, but was still rather bright.  by means of averaging my inaccurate counts i figure it was happening every 20 seconds exactly.  it happened 3 more times, and each time it's luminosity was markedly diminished from the time before, such that i couldn't tell if it continued on and reached a range where the light had become insignificant to my perception, or  simply fizzled out.  the entire event took approximately 3 minutes, and the object only traversed an area of sky which i can only describe as a measure of 'about the distance between my thumb and index finger appear to be when my arm is fully outstretched'.  when i got back to boise i started doing research online to see if what i had witnessed was indeed a known phenomena, but every search parameter i've tried has turned up nothing, so i figured i'd file it here.  if this is something that's already been researched and explained by mufon, could you send me an email at the address that i've included with this form to let me know what it was?  thanks a bunch.
content.summary: Slow moving object emited a series of bright strobe flashes as it tracked across the sky

content.detailedDescription:
Went outside to get something out of the car.  i am an amateur in astronomy but noticed an object that was the size of a star but changing colors very quickly.  didn't really care and finished what i was doing then looked again and notice it had move just a tiny bit but not in alignment with the other stars.  pulled out my telescope (celestron cr-150 hd) to have a look.  i assumed it was an airplane.  when i looked through the scope and resolved on the target it was shocking.  it was a ring of smaller lights with large flashes of light (kinda like lightning) shooting between the ring of lights.  i have seen aircraft many times though the scope but never anything like this.  there was no detail of aircraft surfaces or structure.  the object apeared to be a perfect circle.  it was very far away and was not really that significant against the background constellation unless you knew the constellation.

i tried to get as many photos and video as possible but my camera isn't great at night and under very dark settings.  the target was ~265 degrees at about 10 - 20 degress elevation.  the sky was very clear and the seeing was pretty good.  i got a picture of jupiter to compare if you want it.  i don't know if it would help or not.

1)  at home, unpacking the car after a camping trip.
2)  it isn't normally there.
3)  airplane or satellite
4)  it didn't move fast at all but it didn't move with the stars around it.  it was moving slightly faster and on a different course.
5)  i was pretty shocked and awed since i never seen a ufo and don't believe in aliens.
6)  i was trying to get a good shot through the telescope so i was focusing on trying to get the picture more clear when i looks back and it was gone.  the sky was still very visible and no clouds were anywhere near that area.

end all:  it was an extra star in the night sky i didn't recognize and it was a circle of lights with considerable "lightning" cris crossing from star to star though the circle.

picture 1:  the object photographed through telescope.
picture 2:  the night sky it was in.
video 1:    the object in the telescope.  this was the best captures i have of the object.  if it is slower and cleaned up a bit you can see what i was talking about.
content.summary: Distant object in sky out of place.  looked with telescope and found it was not a star.

content.detailedDescription: I was standing outside at 7:18 pm and the sky had been dark for just under an hour by that time. i had been relaxing and just watching the sky. i noticed a bright circular light coming from the north-west area as i was able to view it as it peaked over my house off in the distance. normally i see air traffic (lots of airplanes) coming in from the north but this one was coming from a different area and look nothing like the other lights. this light was about 3 times brighter and bigger than the planes i usually see and not once did it blink. at first it was really bright but then it dimmed a bit. i thought i was looking at a plane at first but then as it dimmed it looked as if it were really high and i began to think it was a satellite. almost immediately after that thought the light became very bright and was bigger than when i first spotted it. i immediately called my wife outside to see it as to see if maybe she could make out what it is. when my wife came outside the circular light was just about overhead roughly 85 degrees above the horizon line. the object was very close and bright but made no sound as it traveled quickly through the sky. it took about 1 minute to go from when i spotted it peaking out from behind my house off in the nw distance to far off in the south east. when the light was far in the south east area my wife and i noticed the light became much brighter and a bit bigger than before, taking on more of an oval shape. the light then slightly dimmed made a zigzag pattern and disappeared at the end of its pattern, ending right where it would have been the line of travel had it not zigzagged. we don���t know if it went up or just simply disappeared. up until just before the object made the zigzag movement it had traveled in a direct straight line from the nw area to the se area, once again with no sound and at a high rate of speed.
content.summary: I saw a circular light fly nw to se relatively fast without sound. it became very bright and took oval shape. it zigzagged and disappeared.

content.detailedDescription: Mt brother-in-law lives in effort, pa which is close to bucks county.  his back-yard is facing the mountain and forest.  last christmas he asked me about satillites.  he said at night a spot light was shinning down in his bedroom window.  something woke him up and he saw it.  the funny thing is that when he goes to the window the light fades but when he gets back in bed it gets bright.  it happend at least 3 nights then he hung a blanket in his window.  we were kidding it was a ufo.  then i learnd about the bucks co rash of sightings.
content.summary: Strange light in window

content.detailedDescription: We were coming home from town when i was turning on north on the street where i live i glanced to the right because i saw something kind of strange. it was an object that i thought was an airplane because it looked like it had a strobe light but i kept looking at it and the object was not moving. i told my wife and my kids to look at the object. my wife does not like to think about things like that because it freaks her out. so my daughter was looking at the object and we were there for about 30 minutes or so. the object kept changing colors, a red color, blue color then a white color. i took a photo but ny camera could not zoom that much, but i did my best. the object then started moving toward the west northwest slowly till i could barely see the lights. it was kind of freaky being from south texas you dont see this kind of things.
content.summary: Star shape object, changing colors, red blue white the object moved close and then it slowly moved away toward the west northwest.

content.detailedDescription: I looked out the door and saw a light.
content.summary: I was looking out to the east when a light cought my eye., i noticed it was moving towards the south.It appeared  to be as big & bright as saturn. it flew through the sky and faded out when it was about 15 to 30 degrees below jupiter.

content.detailedDescription: I was standing in our front yard in the dark, walking my dog. i always make it a habit to look into the night sky, especially when there are stars visable. i saw a moving object, just a continuous bright white object moving through the sky at a constant rate. infact, the bright white object looked exactely like saturn in the night sky...The exact same, but since saturn was out in the night sky and very bright at this time of year and not too far from the actual moving object, i know it wasn't saturn. my thought was that it looked like a moving star because it didn't flicker or blink at all. i questioned myself about it being a satelite and though it could have been, i don't think so because the object was way too bright and looked to be closer to the surface of the planet then satelites usually get when they fly by up in the sky. the object made it's appearence from a northwesterly to a southeasterly direction, never changing speed or direction the whole time i saw it. i called my husband outside and after the second time of calling him, he came out and looked at the object flying by, we both watched it travel through the night sky towards a southeastern direction. it stayed the same constant bright white light the whole 2 minutes or so that i saw it, no blinking light of any kind and no sound of any kind. just as it appeared to be heading out of sight beyond the tree line, before it disappeared...The bright white light went out (before it reached the tree line). i said to my husband, "it's disappearing", and he replied, "yeah, i see that". we both kept our eye in that spot until we felt it was gone and both of us made mention how strange it was. he is 49 and i am 43 and neither of us has ever seen lights in the night sky quite like that. the whole thing lasted roughly about 2 minutes. unless they make aircraft that fly at night without a blinking light of some kind, but which show a steady white light on it's underbelly that no matter which direction you see it from, shines brightly, then this was no air plane. and, i saw the light come from the tree line and fly ovwer head until it's light just faded out before it hit the other tree line and usually with air planes the headlight will disappear when it moves position and as well, some kind of blinking light are revealed as it travels on...But there was nothing but a constant bright white light that went out before it hit the tree line. later, i went out again and saw three high flying sircraft or satelites and two air planes with their red blinking lights, so whatever it was, it wasn't like anything else that's usually in our night sky.
content.summary: Bright moving object

content.detailedDescription: I live on a lake and was looking at the geese fly in moments ago and then it happened.  a bright, like big meteor came into my vision from the nw and then it almost faded away(8-10 sec).  suddenly it became brighter and appeared to slow down.  i saw no blinking lights and it appeared to (sway) a little. ( i was in the army, this thing didn't move like anything i have ever seen before.  i know it wasn't a plane sat ect, it appeared kind of oval shaped and had some size to it.  the object stayed pretty high up but you could tell it was big 747+!  the movement of it as it slowed across the sky was fluid-like ( weird ). all that happened in 40 seconds and i ran inside my home to retrieve the camera and my woman.  we went out and it slowly came into view above our yard, she sawit, i saw it.  we watched for about a minute before it left our field of view. it left us both with a pretty strange feeling and were both easy going open-minded individuals. i apologize i am not the best typist.  i just thought you guys should know.  maybe someone else witnesses it, who knows.  keep up the quest guys.  j
content.summary: Bright ball, whitish-blue light

content.detailedDescription: I was awakened from a sound sleep at 1:00am give or take a few minutes. the indoor lights were going on and off and there were popping noises, the smoke alarms were beeping. it was raining a light rain, no thunder or lightening. after the indoor lights died, i noticed a strobing light coming in through my bedroom window accompanied by a throb similar to a bass speaker with the volume too loud.I got out of bed and crept to the window. i peered out and whatever it was, was above my condominium complex. the light and noise was coming through the cloud cover, it was bright enough to illuminate the broad river and the bushes growing on the riverbank on the other side.I walked across the hall to wake my grown son but he wouldn't co-operate. i was frightened, so i stayed in his room observing the strobing light outside through the slats of the shutters on his window. they were not the street lights out front pulsing, this was coming from overhead. i got the courage to walk downstairs to the kitchen to get my blackberry. the time said 1:18am. i called my brother who lives in the townhouse three doors down from me. he had fallen asleep on the couch, when the power went out it woke him up. after that, he went outside on his back deck to see where the light was coming from before i called him. he also got the impression that it, whatever it was, was above the cloud cover. he came over to my townhouse and we stood on the front stoop to observe and listen. by this time the light and throbbing sound had drifted southeast of us and we could here sirens from every direction coming from police and ems vehicles in different parts of the town.By this time, my son was awake and came downstairs to join us on the stoop. we all went inside and watched as the light and thrumbing noise drifted southeast towards charleston. i called the police the next morning to inquire as to what happened and at first, i was told that they had no reports of anything going on at that time. i described the lights and noise and the officer put me on hold. he came back several minutes later and told me that a transformer had blown. i thought that was very odd. i have never seen a blown transformer oscillate like that. i did not call sceg because there is no direct person to speak with, you leave a series of touch tone prompts to report outages, and they call back to verify that your power is working again. can you verify that this was a transformer, do transformers behave this way ( i don't think so), could the cloud cover have reflected a pulsing transformer's light to that extent? thanks for any enlightenment that you can provide.
content.summary: Strobing light through cloud cover, throbbing noise accompanied the pulse

content.detailedDescription:
As we sat on the porch,my daughter saw 3 disc shapes in he sky about 10,000 ft. as we sat on the rear porch.Not knowing what could move tike they did we then saw them (one at a time) travel in a straight downward angle at an incredible speed, and then at a right angle into a single cloud in the sky and then dissappearing after sitting in the cloud for about 3 minutes.They were bright metalic with the sun reflecting.

i am a naval veteran and i have seen many aircraft, i have been a passenger on many in the service. i do know how conventional aircraft travel and this did not travel in a conventional way!

there was also a c140 in the sky and it was barely moving(350 to 500 mph)
comparing it to the ufo's we observed.

i, as many others, have heard many stories about ufo's and don't know any more about them other then what i have seen, heard and read. i now believe that there are other "things" that occupy our air space and have taken the stand of believing that they are real!No one can tell me otherwise. if you are a non believer,you had better wake up.If you don't,you are not learning to grow with our knowledge, and believe the skeptic's and there rediculous beliefs. they also thought that we could not travel over 25 mph
without dying from the "g" force (after the invention of the train and auto). they also thought we(earth) was the center of the universe. now galaleo is a revered astronomer! an open mind is a necessary to go foreward.

yes it is possable for the government to have secret technology, but remember,they are now able to travel in a way that is unexplainable.Does that mean that we are in store for more technology. i thing so.

the dogfather
content.summary: 3ufo's traveling straight down and then a sudden 90 degree turn into a single cloud(no other clouds) and dissappeared

content.detailedDescription:
Thursday night. 9/24/09.
truman lake, missouri. northwest of warsaw, mo. northeast of tightwad, mo.
i was night fishing. about 1/4 moon. i only caught a few small ones prior to dark. i put submersible lights down under my small boat at 7:30pm. (it makes my boat look like it's floating on a green light.)

beautiful evening. party cloudy, but could see the stars. so quiet i could hear commercial jets flying high overhead. earlier that day, i saw an apache helicopter fly over. i waved to them and they flew directly over me. not unusual to see as the afb is not too far away. however, about an 1.5 hrs later (precisely 8:31pm), to the north of me, i saw a light flying from north (nnw) to south (ssw). i was just star-gazing when it happened. at first, i thought it was a very bright star. but it moved. it was high enough to be above the clouds. it looked like a car headlight on bright. while traveling on a straight course, about every 15 seconds, it would go dim for about 15 seconds, then bright again. no sound at all. that was very strange, because, i can always hear everything flying over. i was slightly afraid, so i prayed that god would protect me from it. then, i grabbed my digital camera and tried to video record it. the video didn't turn out well. i can barely see it upon replay, unfortunately. :( after flying almost directly above me, the light turned off and the object turned a reddish-orange in color. it had no blinking lights. then, it suddenly disappeared. or it completely went dark before flying away. if it continued on the same path, it would have gone over warsaw, mo. it flew in a relatively straight path. my feeling afterward was somewhat disbelief and wonder.

i've never reported anything like this before and wish to remain anonymous. but i thought you all might be interested.
content.summary: Bright white light that dims and brightens. went out. turned red.

content.detailedDescription:
This white star like ball of light was moving from the north west over la plata county toward the south east at a steady kind of slow speed.  

there were no flashing lights and it never changed course. it looked like a satellite only it was too low for that.  it turned from white into red and then disappeared. immediately following this object was a very high flying plane that appeared to be looking for the object. 

we watched this object for at least 8 mins. it was definitely not a plane, made no noise and when it disappeared it was almost like it went into warp speed and vanished or burned out.
content.summary: Fairly low star like ball of light traveling at a steady speed

content.detailedDescription: My husband, daughter and i were driving south on vermont hill road in holland, ny (great view--@1800ft) around 9:00pm last night.  at 9:03pm we saw a huge flash of light in the southern sky that seemed to fill the whole horizon.  it was brief but bright enough for us to wonder about its origin.  the sky was perfectly clear.  i've been checking the news but there are no reports of anything unusual.  by chance i tried this website (i assumed it was some sort of natural phenomenon) and was surprised to find another witness in ontario reporting a similiar occurrence around the same time.  i suspect we were both seeing the same phenomena.
content.summary: Flash of light in southern sky.

content.detailedDescription:
I was driving east on lapeer road in davison, mi, between irish rd and m-15(state street), at 9:04pm eastern time on friday, september 25th, 2009. suddenly i saw a 4 point star shaped object that had a bright orange center surrounded by a hue that was mostly blue but looked green for a moment. it appeared high in the sky, very far up (i have no idea of how high it was) and fell in a slight arc, going slightly left to right across my vision, straight down, out in the direction of lapeer (east of me).

it seemed to pulse slightly, although that detail is a little hazy. the entire event lasted just under 3 seconds. it was one of those situations where i didn't realize what i was seeing until it was already over. 

the shape was a 4 point star, with points at 0,90,180 and 360 degree points. it seemed to have a curve going from point to point. the object had to be pretty good size, i would estimate it to be at least 200 feet around given how large it looked to my eye. it seemed to only be about 30-50 miles in the distance, but that could be perception playing tricks on me.

i have seen shooting stars, i can promise this was not one of those. it could have been a meteorite or "space junk" or whatever, but the 4 points i saw distinctly and at night seemed to not just be a piece of random junk.

i hope someone else saw this and can give their description of what was seen, it gave me chills!
content.summary: A star shaped (4 points) object fell from the sky and landed somewhere around lapeer, mi!!

content.detailedDescription: I was returning to jacksonville with my brother, sister-in-law and a couple of friends after having gone tubing at ginnie springs. about 45 minutes into our drive, my brother, sister-in-law and i (the friends were passed out) noticed that the inside of our van was being lit from the outside. we were on route 121 (a dark, lampless country road with trees on either side), somewhere between the cities of high springs and raiford. eventually, my sister-in-law got of a glimpse of a light up in the sky from the corner of her windshield, but she was driving and couldn't get a long look. however, she got a good enough glimpse to be puzzled since she noticed it didn't have the same light or movement pattern of regular aircraft. my brother was in the passenger seat and on the wrong side of the road and only experienced the flashing in the inside of our vehicle. i happened to be sitting in the very back and was able to swivel around and stare out of the back window. what i saw was a large, round blue-white light which seemed a bit brighter and condensed at the center and had a diamond-like brilliance. it blinked steadily every few seconds and i would have thought it was a navigation light except for the fact that it was much too big (about the size of a full moon), much too bright (its flash lit up the night sky and the ground below as much as a full moon) and it was not stationary (it moved slowly in the same direction as ourselves and the road but we eventually left it behind). i stared at the object for the several minutes it was in view and i could not figure out what it was. as my sister-in-law observed, it did not move as fast as a plane would, there was no noise of a helicopter or steady helicopter beam, i don't think weather balloons have such a bright light source nor move so steadily. even after the object was lost to curves, distance and trees, i could still see its blue-white flash light up the sky for a few more miles. the entire encounter lasted about 10 minutes.
content.summary: Large, bright, blinking, slowly moving object whose light lit up the night surroundings.

content.detailedDescription:
5:30am - couldn't sleep.
took the dog outside and looked up - chevron style pattern of lights
looking to the southeast
object moving very quickly at a high altitude
street light made it difficult to keep track of object
content.summary: 5 lights.

content.detailedDescription: I just wanted to know if this picture looks like anything you have ever seen in the past?  does it fit any other pictures drawn?
content.summary: Alien?

content.detailedDescription:
Was facing north locking my barn and reflection on barn was so bright we turned around to see the sky was lit up bright as day. 
walked south 100 feet to end of driveway and saw fireball heading south-east towards toronto. 
sparks were flying from tail-end, very bright. 
heard a sort of fizzing during sighting, and faint sort of thunder sound could be heard after object could no longer be seen.
lost sight because of large tree-line in the south.
estimate size as about twice as big as my thumbnail at arm's length.
content.summary: Large fireball with sparks on tail-end.

content.detailedDescription:
At approx. 6:45 pm i went outside to sit and look at the stars. i was looking toward the west when i saw what i thought was a very bright star so i went inside to get my binoculars. when i got back out (about 20 seconds later) i couldn't see the star anymore (which i thought was pretty strange) so i sat down in a lawn chair facing the east. i then saw a very bright light traveling south east and i focused my binoculars on it and saw two lights. i observed this object until it got to within about twenty degrees of the horizon when the lights started turning red and eventually disappeared. i would say the total time from when i started observing the object with the binoculars to when it disappeared was 30 seconds.

i am a pilot and aircraft mechanic and saw no navigation lights on this object. it was traveling at a very high rate and i think that what i was observing was an exhaust from an object that was leaving the atmosphere.
content.summary: Object leaving the atmosphere at very high velocity
